aMcinavaregU tuMbi tuLukuva veYnina baTaTxlu.
\num{3} bahaLa BAriyAdadudx; asAdhAraNa gAtarx yA parxmANavuLaLxdudx:
\eng{a bumper apple} asAdhAraNa gAtarxda seVbu. \eng{bumper traffic}

\num{4} (beLe \mo vugaLa \vi) samaqdidhx; yatheVcaCxvAgiruvike.

AGAtaroVdhaka; kAru \mo\ vAhanavu yAvudakAkxdarU balavAgi Dikikx
hoDedAga A raBasada hoDetavanunx taDedukoLuLxvaMte aLavaDisiruva

\num{4} (raBasavAgi yA haThAtAtxgi, idadxkikxdadxMte,

\num{5} (mogugx, muguLu) biri; araLu. 
\num{6} (niVguRLeLx, kuru) oDe; biri; soPxVTisu.

\num{8} (raBasadiMda)

\num{9} tuMbiru; BatiRyAgiru;

\num{10} (koVpadiMda) siDi; siDidubiVLu. 
\num{11} haThAtatxne, EkAEki -- baru, 
kANisiko, goVcaravAgu: \eng{he burst upon the assembly} avanu saBeyalilx EkAEki kANisikoMDa. 
\num{12} (haThAtatxne yA tiVvarxvAgi BAvagaLanunx) parxkaTisu; parxdashiRsu:

\noindent

kUgu; udagxrisu; udAgxra tege; gaTiTxyAgi mAtADalu toDagu.

\alnum{c} (yudadhx, roVga, galaBe, 
\mo vugaLa \vi) haThAtAtxgi -- taledoVru, uMTAgu, kANisiko; goVcaravAgu. 
\num{8} \eng{burst up}

\alnum{a} siDi; oDe. 

\alnum{b} siDidu hoVgu; nAshavAgu; dhavxMsavAgu. 

\alnum{c} nAshapaDisu; dhavxMsa mADu. 
\num{9} \eng{burst upon} haThAtAtxgi, aniriVkiSxtavAgi -- baru, toVru. 
\num{10}

\bentry

\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} kelasa; kAyaR. 
\num{2} kataRvayx. 
\num{3} kelasa; keSxVtarx: 
\eng{it is not my business to keep watch on the office} kaceVriya kAvalu kAyuvudu nananx 
kelasavalalx. 
\num{4} (parxshenxyAgi yA AkeSxVpavAgi -- baMdudara, hoVdudara) kAraNa; udeVdxsha; 
kelasa: \eng{what is your business here?} ninageVnu kelasa ililx? 
\num{5} kelasa; kasubu; 
vaqtitx; daMdhe; udoyxVga. 
\num{6} (vAyxpAra, vANijayx \mo\ keSxVtarxgaLa) udidxme; udayxma; 
udoyxVga. 
\num{7} (huDugATikeya viSayavalalxda) gaMBiVravAda kelasa: 
\eng{this is no pastime, it is business} idu bariV hotutx kaLeyuva viSayavalalx, idu 
gaMBiVravAda kelasa. 
\num{8} ajeMDa; kAyaRkarxma; muMdiruva, parishiVlisabeVkAda, 
mADabeVkAda -- kelasa: \eng{the business of the day, meeting} iMdina,
saBeya -- kAyaRkarxma.  
\num{9} (janara joteya) vayxvahAra. 
\num{10} parxyAsada kelasa; duBaRrakAyaR: 
\eng{what a business it is} adu eMtha duBaRravAda kelasa. 
\num{11} (vayxMgayxdalilx) doDaDx 
kelasa; mahAkAyaR: \eng{you are making a great business of it} adanunx oMdu mahAkelasa eMdu 
tiLidukoMDididxVye. 
\num{12} obabxna kelasa; obabxnige seVrida, saMbaMdhisida -- viSaya; obabxnu 
keYhAkabahudAda, talehAkabahudAda, parxveVshisabahudAda -- viSaya: \eng{none of your business} 
ninanx kelasa alalx idu. 
\num{13} hakukx; adhikAra: \eng{he has no business to advise me} 
nanage budidhx heVLalu avanige adhikAravilalx. 
\num{14} (\tu) (vicitarx, PajiVti, goVLu, 
holasu, itAyxdi athaRdalilx) kelasa; vayxvahAra; viSaya; saMgati; parisithxti; parxmeVya: 
\eng{I am sick of the whole business} A goVLu kelasa nanage beVjArAgide. 
\eng{it is a queer business} idoMdu vicitarxvAda vayxvahAra. 
\num{15} (nATakadalilxna) 
naTane; aBinaya; raMgada (meVle naDeyuva) kirxye; naTanaTiyara saMBASaNege horatAgi 
AMgikABinaya, calanavalana, hAvaBAva, muKa, \mo vugaLa BaMgi, \mo\ kirxye. 
\num{16} vAyxpAra; 
karxyavikarxya; koLuLxvudu mAruvudu: \eng{doing a great business} BAri vAyxpAra mADutatx. 
\eng{good stroke of business} oLeLxya lABada vAyxpAra. 
\num{17} vANijayx saMsethx; vAyxpArada 
yA vahivATina -- saMsethx. 
\num{18} (aMgaDi, kAKARne, maLige \mo) vAyxpAra, vayxvahAra 
naDeyuva -- sathxLa, jAga: \eng{his business is at the end of the road} avana aMgaDi rasetxya 
koneyalilxde. 
\num{19} (maraNadaMDaneyU seVridaMte) elalx bageya shikeSx yA citarxhiMse. 
\num{20} (\ashi) siguvudelalx; laBayxvAdudelalx.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{in business} 

\alnum{a} vAyxpAradalilx toDagi; vayxvaharisutatx. 

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) kAyaRshiVlavAgiruva; kelasa pArxraMBisuvaMtiruva. 
\num{2} \eng{man of business} 

\alnum{a} (vANijayxsaMsethx, vimAsaMsethx, \mo vugaLa) EjaMTu; parxtinidhi; kAyaRBAri. 

\alnum{b} (kakiSxgAraniMda vakAlatutx paDeda) vakiVla. 

\alnum{c} vayxvahArasathx; vayxvahArapaTu; kelasakAyaRgaLananxritu janaralilx ODADuvavanu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{business as usual} vAyxpAra -- mAmUleV, eMdinaMteyeV; aDacaNegaLidadxrU 
vayxvahAra eMdinaMte sAgutitxde. 
\num{2} \eng{business is business} vayxvahAra eMdare 
vayxvahAra; vAyxpAra eMdare vAyxpAra; lekAkxcAra eMdare lekAkxcAra; vayxvahAradalilx yA 
lABada viSayadalilx dAkiSxNayx, senxVha, \mo vugaLige -- jAgavilalx, eDeyilalx. 
\num{3} 
\eng{do business with} 

\alnum{a} vAyxpAra naDasu. 

\alnum{b} vayxvahAra yA saMbaMdha -- hoMdiru. 

\num{4} \eng{do one's business for one} (\ashi) (obabxnanunx) mugisibiDu; tiVrisibiDu; 
koMduhAku: \eng{``I will do your business for you", he threatened his captive} 
``mugisibiDutetxVne ninanxnunx" eMdu avanu tananx sereyALanunx bedarisida. 
\num{5} 
\eng{get down to business} 

\alnum{a} (mAtu \mo vanunx nililxsi) kelasakekx toDagu; 
sharxdedhxyiMda kelasa -- shurumADu, pArxraMBisu. 

\alnum{b} (upacArada mAtanunx biTuTx) 
viSayakekx bA. 
\num{6} \eng{go about one's business} tananx pADige tAniru; (inonxbabxra 
goDavege hoVgade) tananx kelasa tAnu noVDiko. 
\hyperdef{B}{business nuga(7)}{}
\num{7} \eng{like nobody's business} (\AmA) vilakaSxNavAgi;
asAdhAraNavAgi; sAdhAraNa riVtiyalalxlalxde; sAmAnayx vAyxpitxge
miVri. 
\num{8} \eng{make it one's business} (beVrobabxra kelasavanunx)

\num{9} \eng{mean business} (kelasada bagegx) 
sharxdedhxvahisu; kelasavanunx laGuvAgi kANade gaMBiVrada kelasaveMdu BAvisu: 
\eng{I mean business, it is not a joke} nAnu heVLutitxruvudu bari tamASegalalx, gaMBiVravAda kelasa.
\num{10} \eng{mind your own business} ninanx kelasa noVDiko hoVgu: 
\eng{why do you poke your nose?, mind your own business} idakekxVke tale hAkutitxVye?,

noVDikoLaLxlu heVLu; saMbaMdhapaDada kelasadalilx talehAkadaMte heVLi -- Acege kaLuhisu, 
horadUDu. 
\num{13} \eng{has no business to} (adakekx) hakikxlalx; adhikAravilalx.}

\bentry
\word[but(1)]{but}
\pron{baTf}
\gl{\saMavayx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} Adare; AdaroV; paraMtu; tadivxrudadhxvAgi: \eng{he laughed,
but I did not} vanu nakakx, Adare nAnu nagalilalx. 
\num{2} horatu; vinA; uLidu; biTuTx; shivAyi:
\eng{they are all wrong but he or him} avana horatu avarelalxrU tapupx. 
\num{3} alalxdidadxre; adAgadidadxlilx: \eng{nothing would content him but that I should come} 
nAnu baradidadxre avanige taqpibAradu; nAnu barade hoVdare avanu taqpatxnAga. 
\num{4} aMtirade; aMtilalxde; aMtAgade; hAgirade: \eng{it never rains but it pours} maLe biVLuvudilalx, suriyutatxde. 
\num{5} aMtalalxde; beVre riVti; adara badalu; anayxthA; 
\ -- gatayxMtaravilalxde: \eng{I cannot choose but do it (I cannot but do it)} nAnu adanunx 
mADadiralAre, mADade gatayxMtaravilalx. \eng{what can be do but die?} avanu sAyade 
matetxVnu mADiyAnu? 
\num{6} (otitx heVLuvAga) AdarU: \eng{he may not be learned, 
but he knows how to speak} avanu paMDitanalalx, AdarU mAtADabalalx. 
\num{7} eMdu; eMbudu; eMbudAgi: \eng{I don't doubt but he will do it}
avanu adanunx mADutAtxne eMbudanunx nAnu shaMkisuvudilalx.
\num{8} hAgirade; aMtalalxde; hAge mADade: \eng{never did they meet together 
but a quarrel followed} jagaLa pArxraMBavAgade avaru parasapxra
BeVTiyAdadeVdx ilalx. \eng{justice was never done but someone
complained} yArobabxrU goNagade nAyxya naDedididxlalx. \eng{no man is
so old but he may learn} yAvanigeV Agali kaliyalAgadaSuTx
vayasAsxgiruvudilalx. \eng{not such a fool but he can see it} adanunx
ariyadaSuTx avanu daDaDxnalalx. \eng{there is no one but knows it} adanunx ariyadavanu yAvanU ilalx. \eng{not but that or what he belived it himself} avanu savxtaH adanunx naMbalilalxveMdalalx.
\num{9} (otitx heVLuva padavanunx matetx taruva modalu baLasuva)
Adare, mAtarx, \mo\ \saMavayx: \eng{it must be used always, but
always} adanunx sadA baLasabeVku, sadA aMdare sadA. \eng{I feel years
older, but years older} bahaLa vayasAsxdaMte anisutatxde, bahaLa
bahaLa vayasAsxdaMte.}} 

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{but that} adu -- vinA, biTuTx horatu: \eng{he would have helped us but that he had no money at the time} 
Aga avana hatitxra haNavilalxdudara vinA, avanu namage sahAya mADutitxdadx. 
\num{2} \eng{but then} AdaroV; Adare; AdarU; hAgidadxrU: \eng{she is mischievous but then she is intelligent} avaLu 
bahaLa tuMTi, AdaroV budidhxvaMte. 
\num{3} \eng{not but that or what} hAgilalxdidadxrU; aMtilalxdidadxrU: \eng{I can't come, not but that I would like to} nanage 
barabAradeMdu ilalxdidadxrU, nAnu baralAguvudilalx. \eng{I can't help you, not but what I pity you} ninanx viSayadalilx 
kanikaravilalxveMdalalx, (kanikaravilalxveMdu niVnu BAvisabAradu) Adare nAnu sahAya mADalAre; ninanx bagegx kanikaravidadxrU ninage 
sahAya mADalAre.}
\eentry

saMtoVSavanunx paDeyalu haNa sAdhanavAgalAradu; haNa saMtoVSavanunx koLaLxlAradu. 
\num{3} (yAvudanenxV) koTuTx, tAyxgamADi -- paDe, gaLisu, ajiRsu, saMpAdisu: \eng{freedom is a thing dearly bought}
sAvxtaMtarxyXveMbudu apAra tAyxgadiMda ajiRsida vasutx. \eng{buy favour with flattery} hogaLi anugarxha paDe. 
\num{4} (laMca \mo vanunx koTuTx, adhikAradalilxruva vayxkitx \mo varanunx) koMDuko; vashapaDisiko; olisiko. 
\num{5} (\ashi) opupx; opipxko; naMbu: \eng{if the work is perfect the inspector buys it} kelasa sariyAgidadxre 
infsepxkaTxrf opipxkoLuLxtAtxne. 
\num{6} (\ashi) moVsahoVgu: \eng{he bought the whole story} avanu iDiV
kateyiMda moVsahoVda.
\num{7} (\ashi) hAnigoLagAgu; naSaTxkokxLagAgu. 
\num{8} (\ashi) shikeSxpaDe; shikeSx anuBavisu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\nuga}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{buy a pig in a poke} 

\alnum{a} (vasutxvanunx guNapaTaTx pariVkiSxsade 
koMDukoMDu) odAdxDu. 

\alnum{b} hiMdumuMdu noVDade mAtukoTuTx sikikxhAkiko. 
\num{2} \eng{buy in} 

\alnum{a} sarakugaLanunx oTuTxgaTaTxle koMDu -- dAsAtxnu mADu, saMgarxhisiDu. 

\alnum{b} (mAlikana yA avana kaDeyavana \vi) harAjinalilx itarara
savAlugaLu mAlina belegiMta kaDameyidAdxga, tAneV avugaLigiMta
hecicxna savAlu bele kUgi, mAlanunx punaH koMDuko; matetx paDeduko.

\alnum{c} = \hyperlink{buy(1)nuga(3)}{\nuga ($3$)}.
\hypertarget{buy(1)nuga(3)}{}
\num{3} \eng{buy into} (yAvudeV kaMpaniyalilx) pAludArike 
yA BAga koMDuko. 
\num{4} \eng{buy it} sAyi; sAvige tutAtxgu: \eng{he bought it at the front}

\num{5} \eng{buy off} 

\alnum{a} (hakukxdAranige) haNa salilxsi

\alnum{b} (suligekoVrana hiMse tapipxsikoLaLxlu) daMDa
